StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Whole Exome Sequencing Identifies TTC7A Mutations for Combined Immunodeficiency with Intestinal Atresias

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: Funding for the study of Whole Exome Sequencing Identifies TTC7A Mutations for Combined Immunodeficiency with Intestinal Atresias was provided partly from the NIAID Grant/Contract # 5P01AI076210-04, 1R01AI00887-01, 4U54AI082973-04. Additional Support includes: funding from Stanford University, the Manton Foundation, the Dubai Harvard Foundation for Medical Research, Fondazione Nocivelli and University of Brescia, MIUR (grant 20104HBZ8E_002), Translational Investigator Service award from Boston Children’s Hospital, the National Human Genome Research Institute of the National Institutes of Health (Award Number K99HG007065), the Damon Runyon Cancer Research Foundation (DRG-#2122-22). The datasets used for the analyses described in this manuscript were obtained from dbGaP at http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/projects/gap/XXXXX through dbGaP study accession numbers xxxxx. Data from the Whole Exome Sequencing Identifies TTC7A Mutations for Combined Immunodeficiency with Intestinal Atresias Project were provided by Drs. Michael Snyder, Kari C. Nadeau and Luigi D. Notarangelo on behalf of his collaborators at Stanford University and Harvard University. Drs. Michael Snyder, Kari C. Nadeau and Luigi D. Notarangelo and his/her collaborators request that publications resulting from these data cite their original publication Chen R*, Giliani S*, et al. J Allergy Clin Immunol. 2013 (Accepted).

ConsentGroup.title: General Research Use (IRB)
ConsentGroup.name: GRU-IRB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval.
